Posts.Title: Well, looks like onto the next step gshoemate cindiedee

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2008 07:06AM stacey2930 wrote: Hi Randy,                First let me say how lucky your wife is to have such a supportive husband. It is not often we hear from husbands on this board. I have a wonderful supportive husband also. Let me recommend a book "breast cancer husband" my husband read it cover to cover. It gives a mans perspective of how to deal with the diagnosis and ways to help your wife. You can pick it up at most any book store or order it on Amazon. Take care of yourself and your wife. It will get easier I promise. It's going to be an emotional rollercoaster for a while though. I am 45 I was diagnosed  in 2005. I had radiation. Let me know if I can help in any way. My email address is staceysearcy@hotmail.com Hugs to you and your wife. Stacey

Posts.Title: PreLim Lab Was Positive for Cancer NancyAdiletto NancyAdiletto

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2007 02:57PM stacey2930 wrote: Hi, Sorry you are having to go through this stress. Many of us have been there and can relate to the stress. I would call your MD and ask for Xanax or Ativan. Ativan helps you fall asleep. Xanax will take the edge off a bit. It will be torture to endure this wait without taking something. I remember the sheer panic when I was waiting for my path report. I remember driving 30 miles in the wrong direction try to get to my appointment for my results. The wait is the worst, no doubt about it. But remember you havent been diagnosed with cancer and the chances are in your favor that you wont be. To my understanding 80% of breast lumps are benign. So remember healthy until PROVEN otherwise. Hugs to you. Stacey

Posts.Title: Oncotype DX 16 gj60 san4850

Posts.Content: stacey2930 wrote: I have been estranged from my mom for a number of years. She was emotionally sometimes physically abusive to me and my sister for years. My sister has not spoken to her in 11 years recently I made contact with her to help her financially. She is 77 years old and works full time. To make a long story short she called this morning asking me to come over to "feel a lump she found in her breast" my sister and I both had breast cancer. I feel sick to my stomach. I am not sure of how I will deal with this today when I see her. She is has no money and I believe she has medicare. I will pay for the mammogram next week if I have to. I love my mother but I have to love her at a distance because she has always hurt me when I get too close. I am going to see her now. Say a prayer for me and my mom. Stacey Yesterday is history tomorrow's a mystery and today is a gift that is why it's called the present Dx 10/20/2005, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My Mom called today..... stacey2930 leaf

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2008 09:58PM stacey2930 wrote: Hi everyone,                I went to see my Mom to check the "pea" size lump she has in her left breast. It's right under the nipple underneath an incision from a previous biopsy a long time ago. It appears to be the size of a nickle, it feels irregular and does not move. She is very small so it was easy to locate. I am making her appointment tomorrow. I called my sister in Tennessee but she seemed unconcerned. After all the hurt she has caused me for so many years I still love her. She is my mother and she needs me. I have a feeling it's going to be a looong week. Thank you everyone for your words of kindness.  Love to you all. Stacey
